trans-unit.source: Calculates the dimensions of a rectangle in the client area that contains all the specified controls

seg-source.mrk: Calculates the dimensions of a rectangle in the client area that contains all the specified controls

target.mrk: Calculates the dimensions of a rectangle in the client area that contains all the specified controls

trans-unit.source: A handle to the window that has the client area to check.

seg-source.mrk: A handle to the window that has the client area to check.

target.mrk: A handle to the window that has the client area to check.

trans-unit.source: The array containing the handles or identifiers of the controls that should be included in the calculation of the client area. Also, it can be a single handle or control identifier.

seg-source.mrk: The array containing the handles or identifiers of the controls that should be included in the calculation of the client area.
Also, it can be a single handle or control identifier.

target.mrk: The array containing the handles or identifiers of the controls that should be included in the calculation of the client area.
Also, it can be a single handle or control identifier.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The index of array element that contains the first control.

seg-source.mrk: The index of array element that contains the first control.

target.mrk: The index of array element that contains the first control.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The index of array element that contains the last control.

seg-source.mrk: The index of array element that contains the last control.

target.mrk: The index of array element that contains the last control.

trans-unit.source: $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle with effective client area.

seg-source.mrk: $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle with effective client area.

target.mrk: $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle with effective client area.

trans-unit.source: If the control in the array is visible, or will be visible when its parent becomes visible, its rectangle is subtracted from the effective client rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: If the control in the array is visible, or will be visible when its parent becomes visible, its rectangle is subtracted from the effective client rectangle.

target.mrk: If the control in the array is visible, or will be visible when its parent becomes visible, its rectangle is subtracted from the effective client rectangle.

trans-unit.source: If all the specified controls is missing, the function returns the client area of the parent window.

seg-source.mrk: If all the specified controls is missing, the function returns the client area of the parent window.

target.mrk: If all the specified controls is missing, the function returns the client area of the parent window.

trans-unit.source: Calculate effective client area (excluding Menu, ListView, and StatusBar controls)

seg-source.mrk: Calculate effective client area (excluding Menu, ListView, and StatusBar controls)

target.mrk: Calculate effective client area (excluding Menu, ListView, and StatusBar controls)
